text: Aleksandar Glišić (Čačak, 1873 - Srtevica, near Kumanovo, 23 October 1912) was a lieutenant colonel of the Serbian army who died during the First Balkan War of liberation. Aleksandar Glišić graduated from the Military Academy in Belgrade. During the Battle of Kumanovo, he commanded the 7th Division of King Peter of the Danube Division I. On 23 October 1912, the first day of the battle, he led a self-initiative campaign and in the engagement defeated a larger Turkish force and returned to Srtevica, where he died of severe wounds."Београдске општинске новине", Београд 1. мај 1939. године This act contributed to the division's return to lost positions and stabilized the left wing of its defense. Glišić was buried in the port of the Kumanovo Orthodox Church of the Holy Trinity."Време", Београд 30. октобар 1937. године == References == Category:1873 births Category:1912 deaths Category:People from Čačak Category:People from the Principality of Serbia Category:Serbian military personnel of the Balkan Wars
title: Aleksandar Glišić (soldier)
